S:
## Task ##
You are a navigational agent in a 2D 12x12 grid world filled with specific obstacles and limited by boundaries.
Your objective is to navigate to (11, 6).

## Environment ##
Each cell in the grid is defined through coordinates (r,c).
Your starting position is at (11, 11).
The grid has obstacles located at [(0, 5), (0, 10), (1, 8), (1, 9), (2, 1), (2, 7), (3, 9), (3, 10), (4, 1), (4, 5), (5, 1), (5, 2), (6, 9), (6, 11), (7, 1), (7, 4), (7, 11), (9, 0), (9, 3), (9, 7), (9, 10), (9, 11), (10, 1), (10, 2), (10, 11), (11, 2)].
Collision with boundaries happens when:
r < -1 OR c < -1 OR r > 13 OR c > 13.
If you collide with obstacles the game ends immediately.

## Move commands ##
You can move in four directions:
"up" decreases r by one
"down" increases r by one
"left" decreases c by one
"right" increases c by one

## Objective ##
Given current position (r, c), navigate to (11, 6) using move commands.
Avoid collisions with obstacles and boundaries of the grid.

## Output Format ##
Generate JSON response to the prompt in following format:
{
    "explanation": "",
    "move": "up/down/left/right"
}
A: {"explanation": "Starting at (11, 11). The goal is at (11, 6). Moving 'left' to (11, 10) is the best option since it decreases the column value closer to 6. The new position (11, 10) is not an obstacle and is within the grid boundaries.", "move": "left"}

Your objective is to navigate to (11, 6).

## Environment ##
Each cell in the grid is defined through coordinates (r,c).
Your starting position is at (11, 11).
The grid has obstacles located at [(0, 5), (0, 10), (1, 8), (1, 9), (2, 1), (2, 7), (3, 9), (3, 10), (4, 1), (4, 5), (5, 1), (5, 2), (6, 9), (6, 11), (7, 1), (7, 4), (7, 11), (9, 0), (9, 3), (9, 7), (9, 10), (9, 11), (10, 1), (10, 2), (10, 11), (11, 2)].
Collision with boundaries happens when:
r < -1 OR c < -1 OR r > 13 OR c > 13.
If you collide with obstacles the game ends immediately.

A: {"explanation": "From (11, 10), moving 'up' would take me to (10, 10), which is an obstacle. Moving 'down' would take me to (12, 10), which is out of bounds. Moving 'left' would take me to (11, 9), which is safe and closer to the goal. Moving 'right' would take me to (11, 11), which is farther from the goal.", "move": "left"}
